content.1: Wisdom hath builded her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars:
content.2: She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; she hath also furnished her table.
content.3: She hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon the highest places of the city,
content.5: Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine
content.6: Forsake the foolish, and live; and go in the way of understanding.
content.7: He that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame: and he that rebuketh a wicked
content.8: Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.
content.11: For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased.
content.12: If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but
content.14: For she sitteth at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,
content.15: To call passengers who go right on their ways:
content.17: Stolen waters are sweet, and bread
content.18: But he knoweth not that the dead
